subject: Re: [junit] Constructor called multiple times?
msgSnippet: ... That s only applicable to JUnit 3.8, and I did word it badly originally. Exceptions thrown from the constructor will indicate a problem with the class--I
messageBody:
On 4/4/07, Alexandru Popescu â˜€ <the.mindstorm.mailinglist@...> wrote:

> [...] exceptions thrown from the constructor
> will prevent the individual test method from being reported, while
> exceptions thrown from setUp() are treated as test errors.


That's only applicable to JUnit 3.8, and I did word it badly originally.
Exceptions thrown from the constructor will indicate a problem with the
class--I made it sound in the above like the problem would be silently
swallowed, which is not true. Thanks,

David Saff


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
